snippet: As grieving families marked one year since Japan’s tsunami, some communities are still coming to terms with the calamity’s scale and complexity.
abstract: Grieving families gather across Japan to mark the first anniversary of the earthquake and tsunami that ravaged the northeastern coast, killing almost 20,000 people and causing a huge nuclear radiation leak; many communities, still coming to terms with calamity's scale, complexity and lasting effects, are shaken by new revelations that many victims likely starved to death.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: As grieving families marked one year since Japan’s tsunami, some communities are still coming to terms with the calamity’s scale and complexity.

headline.seo: A Year After Quake and Tsunami, Japan’s Tragedy Lingers
headline.main: An Anniversary of ‘Heartbreaking Grief’ in Japan
headline.print_headline: An Anniversary of ‘Heartbreaking Grief’ in Japan
